text: feathers shell paper over the ages we've
used all sorts of things as money but
what makes money money no seriously the
question comes up as a new kind of
currency bitcoin is grabbing attention
this week US officials are outlining the
perils and promises of Bitcoin in the
first-ever Senate hearing on it
now a lot of you are probably wondering
what really is a Bitcoin bitcoins are
just another iteration of money for
today's digital age no printing press
required so where do they come from
there's no Ben Bernanke of bitcoins no
central bank or government authority at
all the whole thing is underpinned by a
computer network made up of users
machines bitcoins are mathematically
generated by those computers as they
execute difficult number crunching tasks
a process known as mining and mining
it's harder over time so the computer
solves some tough math problems and
accrues bitcoins which it stores on the
computer or with a third-party service
the idea is that only about 21 million
bitcoins can ever be mine but the value
of them can swing wildly in the market
so what do you do with bitcoins some
people just sit on them waiting for the
market to rise others are using them to
buy real things from people who accept
them you can get anything from food
services you can even translate them
into real currency the anonymous nature
of the network raises the question that
maybe you can even buy something illegal
that's what's worrying some authorities
the feds think they may have caught a
man called the Dread Pirate Roberts
accused of running an internet black
market
it all sounds a little crazy but some
big names are getting in on the action
but Winklevoss twins famous for their
involvement in Facebook say the Bitcoin
market could one day be worth 10 times
what it is now and they put millions
into the idea so now we're back to that
question what is money money is money
because we think it has value today and
we think it will have value tomorrow and
it will be able to use it as a medium of
exchange in other words money is money
because we believe in it clearly all
those who bought in believe that bitcoin
has value
